member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.Nul
member.summary: Usually indicates the end of a string.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.FormFeed
member.summary: Meant to be used for printers. When receiving this code the printer moves to the next sheet of paper.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.Escape
member.summary: Starts an extended sequence of control codes.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.Newline
member.summary: Advances to the next line.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.GroupSeparator
member.summary: Defined to separate tables or different sets of data in a serial data storage system.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.HorizontalTab
member.summary: A horizontal tab.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.CarriageReturn
member.summary: Returns the carriage to the start of the line.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels the operation.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.DataLinkEscape
member.summary: Indicates that control characters present in the stream should be passed through as transmitted and not interpreted as control characters.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.EndOfTransmission
member.summary: Signals the end of a transmission.

member.name: F:POS.AsciiControlChars.FileSeparator
member.summary: In serial storage, signals the separation of two files.

member.name: T:POS.NativeMethods.DeviceCap
member.summary: An enumeration of GetDeviceCaps parameters.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.CreateDC(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The CreateDC function creates a device context (DC) for a device using the specified name.
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated character string that specifies either DISPLAY or the name of a specific display device or the name of a print provider, which is usually WINSPOOL.

Pointer to a null-terminated character string that specifies the name of the specific output device being used, as shown by the Print Manager (for example, Epson FX-80). It is not the printer model name. The lpszDevice parameter must be used.
This parameter is ignored and should be set to NULL. It is provided only for compatibility with 16-bit Windows.

Pointer to a DEVMODE structure containing device-specific initialization data for the device driver. The DocumentProperties function retrieves this structure filled in for a specified device. The lpInitData parameter must be NULL if the device driver is to use the default initialization (if any) specified by the user.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to a DC for the specified device. If the function fails, the return value is NULL. The function will return NULL for a DEVMODE structure other than the current DEVMODE.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.DeleteDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The DeleteDC function deletes the specified device context (DC).
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.ClosePrinter(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Closes the specified printer object.
member.param: Handle to the printer object to be closed. This handle is returned by the OpenPrinter or AddPrinter function.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a nonzero value. If the function fails, the return value is zero

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.StartDoc(System.IntPtr,POS.NativeMethods.DOCINFO)
member.summary: The StartDoc function starts a print job.
member.param: Handle to the device context for the print job.
Pointer to a DOCINFO structure containing the name of the document file and the name of the output file.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is greater than zero. This value is the print job identifier for the document.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.EndDoc(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The EndDoc function ends a print job.
member.param: Handle to the device context for the print job.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is greater than zero. If the function fails, the return value is less than or equal to zero.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.GetDeviceCaps(System.IntPtr,POS.NativeMethods.DeviceCap)
member.summary: The GetDeviceCaps function retrieves device-specific information for the specified device.
member.returns: The return value specifies the value of the desired item.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.StartPage(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The StartPage function prepares the printer driver to accept data.
member.param: Handle to the device context for the print job.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is greater than zero. If the function fails, the return value is less than or equal to zero.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.EndPage(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The EndPage function notifies the device that the application has finished writing to a page. This function is typically used to direct the device driver to advance to a new page.
member.param: Handle to the device context for the print job.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is greater than zero. If the function fails, the return value is less than or equal to zero.

member.name: M:POS.NativeMethods.StartDocPrinter(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,POS.NativeMethods.DOC_INFO_1)
member.summary: The StartDocPrinter function notifies the print spooler that a document is to be spooled for printing.
member.param: Handle to the printer. Use the OpenPrinter or AddPrinter function to retrieve a printer handle.
Specifies the version of the structure to which pDocInfo points. On WIndows NT/2000/XP, the value must be 1.
Pointer to a structure that describes the document to print.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value identifies the print job. If the function fails, the return value is zero.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOCINFO.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the structure.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOCINFO.lpszDocName
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the document.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOCINFO.lpszOutput
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of an output file. If this pointer is NULL, the output will be sent to the device identified by the device context handle that was passed to the StartDoc function.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOCINFO.lpszDatatype
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the type of data used to record the print job. The legal values for this member can be found by calling EnumPrintProcessorDatatypes and can include such values as raw, emf, or XPS_PASS. This member can be NULL. Note that the requested data type might be ignored.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOCINFO.fwType
member.summary: Specifies additional information about the print job. This member must be zero or one of the following values.

member.name: T:POS.NativeMethods.DOCINFO
member.summary: The DOCINFO structure contains the input and output file names and other information used by the StartDoc function.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOC_INFO_1.pDocName
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the document.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOC_INFO_1.pOutputFile
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the name of an output file. To print to a printer, set this to NULL.

member.name: F:POS.NativeMethods.DOC_INFO_1.pDataType
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that identifies the type of data used to record the document.

member.name: T:POS.NativeMethods.DOC_INFO_1
member.summary: The DOC_INFO_1 structure describes a document that will be printed.
